title: The Lost Map of Marrow Isle
author: A. R. Vale

sections.text: You find an old map tucked inside a library book. The ink shows an island with a single X.

options.description: Follow the map to the harbor and hire a small boat.
Ignore the map and research the island in the library.

sections.text: The boatman warns of storms. Midway, waves toss the boat and a crate breaks loose.

options.description: Try to secure the crate and help the boatman.

consequence.text: You cut your hand on splintered wood.

options.description: Let the boatman handle it and hold on tight.

sections.text: Records show the island was once a lighthouse station. A journal mentions a hidden cave.

options.description: Head to the harbor with the new clue.
Search the journal for a name to ask about the island.

sections.text: Your quick action saves the boat. The boatman offers to share a secret: the island has a guardian.

options.description: Ask about the guardian and press on to the island.
Decide the risk is too great and return home.

sections.text: You arrive at the island. At the shore you see footprints leading into dense trees.
The journal mentions a keeper named Mara who vanished. A note hints she hid something to protect it.

options.description: Find Mara's descendants in town for more information.
Use the journal's map to go directly to the island.

sections.text: In the island's heart you meet a stone guardian who tests your intent. You pass by showing respect.
You return home safely but wonder what might have been. The map remains a mystery.
Footprints lead to a hidden cave where the lost treasure glows faintly. You claim the map's secret.
On the rocks you find a washed-up chest, but it's emptyâ€”except for a note: 'The real treasure is the story.'
Mara's granddaughter gives you a key and a warning: some things are better left guarded.
